Detailed Description

Steps in order to initialize the ICAdministration object.

All administration routines of the Companion are provided by the ICAdministration class. This can be initialized as following:

  • Retain the global class instance by calling sharedICAdministration
  • Set the delegate property to a valid object that conforms to the ICISMPDeviceDelegate and ICAdministrationDelegate protocols
  • Call the openICAdministration method to open the Administration channel
  • Test the isAvailable property to check if the Administration channel is ready to be used

Function Documentation

- (void) close

Close the Administration channel.

This method closes the ICAdministration channel (its input and output streams) without having to release the object. After this method is called, the isAvailable property is set to NO, and all the subsequent commands that are sent to the terminal fail.

- (iSMPResult) open

Open the Administration channel.

This is a synchronous method that opens the Administration channel. It has a timeout of 15 seconds after which the channel is deemed not to be available. This method may return one of the following constants defined within eISMPResult enumeration:

  • ISMP_Result_SUCCESS: if the call is successful
  • ISMP_Result_ISMP_NOT_CONNECTED: if the open fails because the terminal is not connected
  • ISMP_Result_Failure: if the call failed for another reason - this may be because the application does not declare the Administration protocol or that the terminal does not support this protocol.

The isAvailable property of ICAdministration is set to YES when the call to open is successful, to NO when it fails.

Returns
An integer constant defined with the eISMPResult enumeration.
+ (id) sharedChannel

Returns the unique shared instance of ICAdministration.

The object returned by this method is autoreleased. It is then necessary to retain it.

Returns
A pointer to the shared instance

Properties

- (id<ICISMPDeviceDelegate,ICAdministrationDelegate>) delegate
readwritenonatomicassign

The delegate object that should implement the ICAdministrationDelegate protocol.

By implementing the protocol, the delegate is notified with ICAdministration's events
